titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

scopecontent.p: The musical manuscripts by William Henry Fry, 1815-1864, critic, newspaper man, lecturer and composer. Fry's works are fully described in William Treat Upton's "The Musical Works of William Henry Fry in the collections of The Library Company of Philadelphia," a research Bulletin of The Free Library of Philadelphia, Philadelphia, 1946. Included are Aurelia The Vestal, a lyrical tragedy in 3 acts, full score; Leonora, a lyrical drama in 3 acts, score incomplete; Notre Dame of Paris, full score; Stabat Mater or The Crucifixion of Christ, full score; Kyrie Eleison, full score; Santa Claus: Christmas Symphony, full score; and Overture to Macbeth, full score.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
